content: Ah, but they will leave, sooner or later. I agree that the people around you have maybe the biggest effect on your job satisfaction — but the people around you are out of your control usually. People leave because a spouse gets another job, another kid arrives, a better offer arrives, they get re-assigned, and so on. It’s truly rare to have the same co-workers for long periods these days. And when you yourself need to move on, chances are good that wherever you interview next, you’ll have very little ability to evaluate how much you’re going to like the new work crew. Sucks, but that’s pretty much how it is.
